newsitem.title: UK: UK shares seen sharply down after Wall St tumble.
newsitem.headline: UK shares seen sharply down after Wall St tumble.

text.p: British shares were braced for heavy early losses on Tuesday as two successive sessions of sharp decline on Wall Street take their toll on European equity markets, dealers said.
The Dow tumbled 157 points on Monday after an 140-point dive on Thursday, for an aggregate 4.3 percent decline. Since London closed on Thursday, the Dow has shed around 250 points.

"Normally you'd say the market would go along with 50 percent of what Wall Street does," one British strategist said. "But as we've all been waiting for a correction of some sort we could easily see the FTSE 100 lose three percent."
